intro: Pycreus albomarginatus var. bromoides, commonly known as the white-margin spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. The plant typically grows in moist, shady environments and features strap-like, grassy leaves. Its blooming period occurs during the spring and early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. The varietal name 'bromoides' refers to its resemblance to the genus Bromus, which includes various grasses.
